thag10.3:1.1: If you’re prepared for the future,
thag10.3:1.2: both the good and the bad,
thag10.3:1.3: then those who look for your weakness,
thag10.3:1.4: whether enemies or well-wishers, will find none.
thag10.3:2.4: as it was taught by the Buddha:
thag10.3:2.6: like the moon freed from a cloud.
thag10.3:3.3: it has broken through and been uplifted—
thag10.3:4.4: even a rich person doesn’t really live.
thag10.3:6.1: It’s not a teaching just for today;
thag10.3:7.3: Everyone who is born here dies here;
thag10.3:7.4: such is the nature of living creatures.
thag10.3:8.1: The things that are useful for the living
thag10.3:8.2: are of no use for the dead—not fame, not celebrity,
thag10.3:8.3: not praise by ascetics and brahmins.
thag10.3:8.4: For the dead, there is only weeping.
thag10.3:9.1: And weeping impairs the eye and the body;
thag10.3:9.4: but your well-wishers are not happy.
thag10.3:10.1: So you should wish that those who stay in your family
thag10.3:10.3: and do their duty through the power of wisdom,
thag10.3:10.4: just as you’d cross a full river by boat.
